data.title: GDL providers compared
data.meta_description:
The studentâ€™s guide to careers in the law. Gives the truth about law firms and the Bar. Based on thousands of interviews with trainees,
                                             pupils and market sources, this site offers the full package of careers advice to anyone entering the legal profession.
data.text:
2:2 in any subject or overseas equiv (inolving at least 3 yrs of study) or meet the requirements of the SRA / the BSB for entry as a mature student or equiv academic or vocational qualifications that meet the requirments of the SRA / the BSB.

Obtain good hons degree awarded by a recognised UK / Republic of Ireland institution (at least 2:2 if wanting to qualify as a barrister). Applicants with non-standard UK degrees or qualifications obtained overeseas may need to obtain a CAS. Prospective barristers should obtain the certificate from the BSB. Non-native English speakers: IELTS minimum 6.5 overall a minimum of 5.5 in each elements.

Non-law bachelor's degree (from UK university

or recognised by the BSB if you wish to study the BPTC), or a 'stale' law degree, where 5+ years have elapsed since graduation, or an academic or professional qualification at degree equiv level. Non-native English speakers: IELTS 7.5 overall with minimum of 6.5 in all components.

UK Honours degree in non-law subject, 2:2 or above.

Applicants from overseas or non-standard qualifications need Certificate of Academic Standing from BSB (qualifying as barrister). Non-native English speakers: IELTS overall 6.5, minimum 6.5 in writing & subscores of 6.0 minimum in readying, speaking & listening.

Degree in any subject of at least an upper 2:2 hons, conferred by an institution in the UK, Ireland or Council for National Academic Awards.

Non-native English Speakers: IELTS 7.0 minimum with 6.5 in writing and 6.0 in all other components.

Degree in any subject, minimum 2:2 grade (UK or Republic of Ireland Higher Education Institution; or overseas institution (subject to apptoval by International Admissions process at UCLan).

Non graduates still considered - advised to make pre-application contact with Admissions Tutor to discuss. Non-native English speakers: IELTS 6.5 (no individual component below 6.0) or equivalent.

Qualification as a barrister: hold UK/Republic of Ireland degree, awarded 2:2 minimum.

Overseas degree or non-standard UK/Republic of Ireland degreee: granted a Certificate of Academic Standing by the Bar Standards Board.

Approved by the BSB Board Qualifications Committee as suitable for admission as a mature student.

Minimum 2:2 hons degree or equivalent previous experience.

IELTS 6.5 minimum, 6.0 each component.

Pearson 58-64 (minimum 51 in each component for UKVI Purposes).

RPL is accepted on this programme.

International students applying to study FT taught Masters, MRes, MPhil or PHD at LJMU check if require an ATAS certificate.

UK degree at 2:2 level minimum (applicants who do not hold a UK fist degree must obtain a Certificate of Academic Standing from SRA or BSB. Must demonstrate proficiency in English Language. If require a Tier 4 student visa, may need to provide IELTS.

Undergraduate degree in any subject, or equivalent UK/ Overseas qualifications, or a Certificate or Academic Standing from the Law Society or the Bar Council. Applicants who have previously studied four or more of the foundation subjects may obtain an exemptions from those subjects. Applicants from exemption should be made to the SRA or the BSB. International applicants required to have a minimum overall IETS (Academic) score of 6.5 with 5.5 in each component (or approved equivalent).

UK: Undergraduate degree (2:2 or above). Applicants should ensure that their referee provides a full reference in support of their application. Course only open to those holding qualifications approved by the SRA or BSB under the regulations in force from time to time. Anyone with non-standard qualifications may need to obtain a CAS from either BSB or SRA before they enrol on the GDL. International: accept qualifications from schools, colleges and universities all over the world for entry onto postgraduate degrees. Non-native English speakers - need an IELTS test or alternative English language test.

2:2 degree or above & application should also demonstrate a commitment to the legal profession. However, all applications are considered on their mertis and consider applicants who do not have or may not be predicted to have an upper second class honours degree who can demonstrate a commitment to pursuing a career in the legal profession and who have other strengths or evidence of achievement such as awards, scholarships and work experience. Non-native English speakers - IELTS score of 7.0, including a minimum of 6.5 in each component.

2:2 undergraduate hons degree or above. Qualification can be in any subject. You may also be considered for the course if you have other professional qualifications or experience of equivalent standing. English language requirements: Standard level (6.5 overall, including at least 6.0 in each component).

Minimum of a 2:2 or overseas equivalent grade. Non-native English speakers need an IETS score of 6.5 overall, with 6.0 in each element.
